sources.title: "A Dozen Socks" (1927) starring Alice Day
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems   "A Dozen Socks" is short comedy starring Alice Day, a star of Silent Hall of Fame. This film print is very rough. Unfortunately very few of Alice Day's films survive, so let's be thankful for what we have and enjoy this short comedy.  Directed by                             Earle Rodney, Larry Semon (uncredited) Produced by                           Mack Sennett Scenario                                  Larry Semon  Starring                                   Alice Day, Danny O'Shea, Barney Hellum Cinematography                     William Williams Distributed by                         Pathecomedy Film Editor                              William Hornbeck Release date                             March 13, 1927 Running time                           14 m. Country                                    United States Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976: "Allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. Fair use is a use permitted by copyright statute that might otherwise be infringing. Non-profit, educational or personal use tips the balance in favor of fair use."

metadata.Plot: Spike O'Brien, a lowly boxing trainer, must compete for the heart of his beloved Molly Maloney, against tough boxing champion Felix Dugan. Can Spike defeat the champion; win the $500 prize and more importantly Molly's heart?
metadata.Writer: Al Giebler, Carl Harbaugh, George Jeske
metadata.Actors: Alice Day, Danny O'Shea, Marjorie Zier
